clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics of Off Label Pediatric Medications
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetics of Off Label Pediatric Medications

lead_sponsor.agency: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

clinical_study.source: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to measure the level of medicines found in body fluids such as blood, urine, spinal fluid of children.

detailed_description.textblock: There is a lack of safety, pharmacokinetic and efficacy data of therapeutic agents in children and infants. Samples used for measurement will be from scavenged samples. i.e. any extra blood/body fluid samples from a test done as part of the standard of care.

primary_outcome.time_frame: The time frame for the outcome measure may vary depending on the length of the course of the medication. However, it would be expected to be approximately 10-21 days.
primary_outcome.description: Area under the curve (AUC), Volume, Distribution, Half life, Clearance, standard SAE and AE reporting per FDA guidelines

clinical_study.condition: Off Label Use of Medications in Pediatric Patients

study_pop.textblock: children < 8 years of age currently receiving a therapeutic agent at a dose or for an indication not currently included on the FDA label as part of standard of care

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children less than 8 years of age
- Receiving a therapeutic agent at a dose or for an indication not currently included on the FDA label as part of standard of care
Exclusion Criteria:
- Lack of consent
